pr_title: KAFKA-9944: Added supporting customized HTTP response headers for Kafka Connect.

timeline.message: Added supporting customized HTTP response headers for Kafka Connect.

timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: Why not implement these as a ConfigDef.Validator implementation, similar to the existing AdminListenersValidator below?
timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: Is this line really necessary? Isn't the response.http.headers.config property already logged at INFO level when the worker starts up, via the WorkerConfig (or rather DistributedConfig or StandaloneConfig) constructor?
timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason we don't want to validate these properties up front when all of the other configuration validation is being performed, via ConfigDef.Validator on response.http.headers.config? If we do that, we don't need this line.
timeline.author: rhauch
rhauch
rhauch

timeline.bodyText: The advantage of using ConfigDef.validator on the response.http.headers.config config key is that this constructor call would throw an exception if any invalid value is used, and much sooner, too.
timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: Should we have tests for the DistributedConfig class? Again, much of the logic should be the same, but the tests would each be simpler if using a ConfigDef.Validator.
timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: If using ConfigDef.Validator, all of these lines would go away, and we actually don't need mocks of any kind.
timeline.author: rhauch

timeline.bodyText: Might be nice to have quite a few of these tests that verify various values are invalid and valid, to act as regression tests.
timeline.author: rhauch
